action.translation[0].definitions[0].def: the process of doing something, especially in order to achieve a particular thing
action.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The government must take action (=do something) now to stop the rise in violent crime.
She was looking forward to putting her ideas into action (=doing the things she had planned).
Ambulance crews are ready to spring into action (=suddenly start doing something) if anything goes wrong during the race.
Environmental groups want tougher action on pollution from cars.
action.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The child could not be held responsible for his actions (=he was too young to be blamed for them).
Her prompt actions probably saved my life.
The chief of police tried to justify his actions.
action.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: There have been reports of widespread enemy action in the area.
530 servicemen were reported missing in action (=they were never seen again after a battle).
The men were sent into action with little or no training.
He had seen action (=been involved in fighting) in Korea.
His father was killed in action in Vietnam.
action.translation[0].definitions[3].def: a legal or formal process to decide whether someone has done something wrong
action.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: They are threatening to take legal action against the hospital  (=start a court case against them).
The director faces disciplinary action (=official action to punish him).
The matter is now the subject of a court action (=a court case).
The students agreed to drop their action (=decided not to continue with a court case or an official complaint).
The sisters brought a libel action against the newspaper  (=started a court case).
action.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: There hasn’t been much action around here for months.
New York is where all the action is.
action.translation[0].definitions[5].def: an action film has a lot of exciting scenes in it, in which people fight, chase, and kill each other
action.translation[0].definitions[5].exa: Gibson became famous in action movies.
action.translation[0].definitions[6].def: the way something moves or works
action.translation[0].definitions[7].def: the effect that a substance, especially a chemical, has on something
action.translation[0].definitions[7].exa: The drug blocks the action of the cancer gene.
the action of alcohol on the liver
action.translation[0].note_box[0].headin: – Meaning 1: the process of doing something, especially in order to achieve a particular thing
action.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: take action
The government must take action to control inflation.
demand/call for action
Voters are demanding tougher action on gun crime.
swing/spring/leap into action
The fire crew immediately swung into action.
put something into action
She was looking forward to putting her plans into action.
The committee uses the expertise of local organisations to put these ideas into action.
immediate/prompt/swift action
The public wants immediate action to stop the terrorists.
urgent action
The Opposition called for urgent action to reduce unemployment.
firm/tough action
We need firm action to deal with the problem.
decisive action
We are urging the international community to take decisive action on debt relief.
drastic action
The president decided to take drastic action.
further action
No further action is necessary.
direct action
In a bid to stop whale hunting, Greenpeace have threatened direct action.
political action
Some forms of political action are more effective than others.
industrial/strike action
The miners voted in favour of industrial action.
joint action
Community leaders agreed to take joint action on scientific, social and environmental issues.
a course of action
Have you decided on a course of action?
a plan of action
The General outlined his plan of action for the campaign.
Environmental groups have put forward an action plan.
action.translation[0].note_box[1].sectio: Four of her sons have been killed in action.
A further 9,000 allied military personnel are still officially listed as missing in action.
By the time he was 20 he’d seen action in the Gulf War and Bosnia.
American soldiers are going into action against the Mujahadin.
He declared that French soldiers will not be sent into action in Iraq.
America is not ruling out military action against Iran.
The ship was damaged by enemy action.
action.translation[0].note_box[2].headin: – Meaning 6: a legal or formal process to decide whether someone has done something wrong
action.translation[0].note_box[2].sectio: The singer threatened legal action against the magazine.
The couple are still considering whether to take court action.
Judge Johan Kreigler dismissed a libel action brought against two newspapers.
The victim can seek damages in a civil action.
He is within his rights to take legal action.
The council demanded that we remove the posters, or face legal action.
Justice Mayor ruled that she cannot bring a legal action for damages against the plaintiff.
action.translation[0].note_box[3].sectio: action
something that someone does
He is responsible for his own actions.
They refused to give a reason for their actions.
act
a particular type of action
violent acts
I believe the killing was an act of desperation.
activities
things that people do, especially for enjoyment or to achieve an aim
leisure activities
political activities
Surveys may not give a true picture of people’s activities.
the things that someone does and the way they behave
Do you think that advertisements really influence people’s behaviour?
The man’s behaviour seemed rather odd.
something that you do in order to achieve something
Her decision to sell the shares had been a smart move.
It’s a bold move to start a business in the current economic climate.
He needed time to figure out his next move.
one of a series of things that you do in order to deal with a problem or to succeed
The first step is to make sure we have got funding for the project.
We must take steps to make sure that this does not happen again.
This is an important step towards peace.
measure
an official action that is intended to deal with a particular problem
There are increased security measures at airports.
The school was closed as a precautionary measure following a chemical leak.
gesture
something that you do to show how you feel about someone or something
Do you think it would be a nice gesture to send her some flowers?
The company gave us £100 as a gesture of goodwill.
deed
an action, especially one that is very good or very bad
evil deeds
heroic deeds
This is my good deed for the day.
exploits
exciting or brave actions
daring exploits
His exploits were legendary.
feat
something someone does that people admire because you need a lot of skill, courage, or strength to do it
Completing a marathon is a remarkable feat for a six-year-old.
The bridge is a great feat of engineering.
action.translation[1].definitions[0].def: used by film directors to give the instruction to begin filming
action.translation[2].definitions[0].def: to do a specific thing that needs to be done, especially after discussing it
action.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: How are we actually going to action these objectives?
action.translation[3].definitions[0].def: when someone does something in order to deal with a problem or difficult situation
action.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: The government’s action was prompted by shortages of foreign exchange.
We must take action to make our shares accessible to a broader segment of the investing public.
action.translation[3].definitions[1].def: when important things happen, for example when there is a lot of buying or selling or prices rise or fall
action.translation[3].definitions[1].exa: The tax cut was intended to restore some market action in the banking and real-estate sectors.
action.translation[3].definitions[2].def: the process of taking a case or a claim against someone to a court of law
action.translation[3].definitions[2].exa: They began an action to repossess the house.
When the loan was not repaid, he threatened legal action.
They will bring an action against him if he does not repay the loan.
